item.title: My Phone is Ruining My Creativity
item.description: Author: Eric Floberg URL: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ecx8u4inJHM Boredom breeds creativity Therefore, avoiding being bored is the death of creativity. Basic steps you can try: Don’t check your phone for the first hour you wake Don’t check your phone while moving Don’t check your phone on the toilet Don’t check your phone the hour before bed

item.title: Time Sinks
item.description: Time Traps I have to watch out for: Twitter - Truly infinite, very dangerous Feedly - This one at least has an end, but this one can still be 15-20 minute trap YouTube Wordle - At least only one a day and usually is less than 5 minutes Reddit - Another truly infinite trap You especially need to watch out for these during My Morning Routine as they will eat up your Most productive time of the day...

item.title: Technical Requirements
item.description: I think my issue with technical requirements is they distract from the engineer thinking about the user and what they are trying to do. This can be helpful in a scenario where the developer has no concept of the user’s needs, but if your engineer has empathy or experience with these people you are coaxing the developer to stop thinking about the user’s needs and to focus on checking these checkboxes....

item.title: Performance vs Trust
item.description: Author: Simon Sinek URL: https://youtu.be/kJdXjtSnZTI Businesses are good at measuring performance, but bad at measuring trustworthiness. The Navy Seals think of people in a Performance vs Trust matrix. Ideally you want the high performance, high trust individual, but if you can’t have that person you should value high trust over high performing....

item.title: Obsidian Keybinds
item.description: Obsidian Keyboard Shortcuts These are my custom keybinds for Obsidian Open Today’s Daily Note: CMD+Shift+D Previous Day: CMD+Shift+J Next Day: CMD+Shift+K Open Weekly Note: CMD+Shift+W Previous Week: CMD+Shift+H Next Week: CMD+Shift+L Delete Note: CMD+Shift+Backspace Refactor Selection with First Line as Title: CMD+Shift+C Apply Template: CMD+T Close Panes Close Left Pane: CMD+ Close Right Pane: CMD+Shift+\

item.title: The Tickler File
item.description: Author: David Allen URL: https://gettingthingsdone.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/2016-Tickler-File-.pdf The Tickler File is an organizational tool which can be used to simplify the tracking of date-related items and to manage work flow. It works well as an adjunct to personal planners and calendars, allowing them to be used for streamlined focus on items that require on-going review and access....

item.title: EHR Core Values
item.description: EHR The original goals behind EHRs were to make claims flow more efficiently and I would argue that in many ways they are doing that. Our goal when set out to build Dorsata was to build the missing specialty specific clinical layer and top of the existing EHR....

item.title: Challenges Designing in Healthcare
item.description: Healthcare Design Optimizing for data specificity vs time spent charting Knowing where aspects of the chart need structure vs where others should be more flexible Attempting to create linearity in an inherently non-linear field Creating clean intuitive designs with a information density preferred by clinicians Data interoperability between Health System to Health System and also Patient to Health System Reforming the cost of healthcare to incentivize better outcomes....
